title: Orlando-bound JetBlue flight diverts to JFK after crew reports smoke in cockpit
text:
CLOSE

NEW YORK – Officials say a JetBlue Airways flight bound for Orlando has safely landed at John F. Kennedy International Airport after the crew reported smoke in the cockpit and declared an emergency.

The Federal Aviation Administration says JetBlue Fight 227, an Airbus A320, had departed Newark Liberty International Airport en route to Orlando International Airport when it was diverted. It landed at JFK shortly after 7:30 p.m. EDT Sunday.

A JetBlue spokesman says the crew had noticed an “electrical smell” in the cockpit. He said the passengers continued on to Orlando in a new aircraft.

The FAA said it will investigate.

Read or Share this story: https://www.usatoday.com/story/travel/airline-news/2019/10/14/jetblue-flight-diverts-jfk-after-crew-reports-smoke-cockpit/3973426002/
description: JetBlue Flight 227 had divert to JFK Sunday after crew members noticed smoke and an "electrical smell" in the cockpit. The FAA is investigating.
